campaign.name: a dark bear on the horizon
campaign.description: An ancient evil stirs beneath the frozen shores of Hiberia, as demonic corruption seeps through the ice into the ancestral nordic burial grounds. As the northern lights twist with unnatural colors, you must descend into the frozen depths to prevent an invasion that threatens to spread beyond the eternal winter.

objectives.description: Find the entrance to the ancient nordic burial site among the shattered remains of viking longships.
Recover the Frostkey Totem needed to unlock the burial grounds entrance.
Gather ritual components from the abandoned fishing village to perform the opening ceremony.
Defeat the corrupted shaman who guards the entrance to the burial site.

dialogue.intro: The ice speaks to me now... it whispers of your doom! You cannot stop what grows beneath!
dialogue.defeat: The chill... it leaves my bones... beware what sleeps in the ancient halls...

objectives.description: Navigate through the hall of fallen warriors, whose bodies now rise to defend their corrupted resting place.
Collect the ancient rune tablets to decipher the prophecy of the demonic invasion.
Reach the ancient feasting hall where the corrupted chieftains gather to perform vile rituals.
Defeat the corrupted Jarl who has made a pact with the demons below.

dialogue.intro: My people sought warmth in the endless winter... The demons promised fire eternal! Now you will freeze with the rest!
dialogue.defeat: The pact... was a lie... Below in the depths... they prepare... their true champion...

objectives.description: Navigate through the labyrinthine ice caverns where reality begins to warp under demonic influence.
Recover pieces of the shattered Frostbane Blade from the corrupted ice lake.
Destroy the demonic eggs that incubate in the frozen depths, guarded by their monstrous caretaker.
Reach the edge of the great rift where the barrier between realms grows thin.

dialogue.intro: My children grow strong in this frozen womb! Your warmth will feed their hunger, your soul will fuel their birth!
dialogue.defeat: My brood... will avenge me... The Herald rises... from the deepest ice...

objectives.description: Battle through the heavily guarded entrance to the demonic sanctum hidden beneath the primordial ice.
Find and destroy the unholy altars where nordic souls are harvested to power the demonic portal.
Recover the Frostbane Blade's hilt and reforge the legendary weapon to combat the final demon lord.
Confront and defeat Rimefang, the Demon Lord of Eternal Winter, before his invasion of Hiberia can begin.

boss.name: Rimefang, Herald of the Frozen Apocalypse

dialogue.intro: At last, a worthy soul approaches! The eternal winter I bring is not death, mortal - it is transformation! All of Hiberia shall become my frozen kingdom!
dialogue.defeat: Impossible... I am... endless... like winter itself... My master will... avenge... this defeat... The true lord of frost... will rise...

quests.name: The Frozen Corruption
quests.description: Investigate the strange occurrences along the frozen shores of Hiberia and discover the source of demonic corruption.

quests.name: The Frostbane Legacy
quests.description: Recover and reforge the legendary Frostbane Blade, the only weapon capable of defeating Rimefang.

quests.name: The Lost Expedition
quests.description: Find traces of a previous expedition that ventured into the frozen depths but never returned.

quests.name: Runes of Warding
quests.description: Collect ancient rune stones to create protective wards against demonic influence.

quests.name: The Frozen Shaman
quests.description: Free the spirit of an ancient shaman who can teach you protective frost magic.

quests.name: Corrupted Offerings
quests.description: Destroy the corrupted offerings left by cultists trying to curry favor with the demons.

quests.name: Memories in Ice
quests.description: Recover the frozen memories of the village elders to learn how the corruption first began.

quests.name: The Last Valkyrie
quests.description: Find and aid a wounded Valkyrie who seeks to prevent the souls of fallen warriors from being corrupted.

metadata.description: Once a vibrant fishing settlement, Tristram now stands as a somber outpost on Hiberia's frozen coast, its wooden buildings creaking under the weight of perpetual snow. The townsfolk huddle around meager fires in the town square, their wary eyes constantly drawn to the disturbing aurora that writhes above the ice-locked harbor like spectral serpents. Ships that once brought trade now sit abandoned, half-submerged in the frozen waters, their hulls encrusted with an unnatural blue frost that seems to pulse with faint, unholy light.
metadata.lore: Tristram was founded by Nordic settlers who discovered that the waters here remained mysteriously unfrozen even during the harshest winters, allowing year-round fishing. Elders speak of ancient warnings carved into runestones at the town's edge, telling of 'that which sleeps beneath' and how the ancestors sealed something terrible beneath the harbor ice centuries ago.
secrets: The town elder's cellar contains a hidden chamber with wall carvings depicting a ritual that can strengthen the weakening ancestral seals
A seemingly mad hermit living in an isolated hut actually guards an ancient artifact that can navigate the twisting ice tunnels beneath the harbor
The strange blue crystals growing on some buildings are actually frozen demonic blood, and when melted can reveal visions of the corruption's source

objectives.description: Find the entrance to the ancient nordic burial site among the shattered remains of viking longships.

metadata.description: Shipwreck Cove emerges from the mist as a graveyard of shattered vessels, their wooden hulls frozen in eternal suffering against jagged ice formations. The constant moan of wind through frost-covered masts creates an eerie chorus, while beneath the translucent ice floor, dark shapes occasionally shift, tracking movement from below.
metadata.lore: Once a thriving harbor for Hiberian raiders, Shipwreck Cove was consumed by an unnatural freeze during the Night of Fallen Stars three centuries ago, trapping an entire fleet and its warriors in mid-departure. Local shamans claim the raiders were fleeing with a forbidden artifact stolen from the burial grounds - their punishment now serving as a warning to those who disturb the ancient dead.
secrets: A still-living Hiberian raider captain is preserved in ice deep within the largest ship, his consciousness trapped and aware for centuries
The shipwrecks are arranged in a pattern that forms a binding rune, visible only from certain vantage points
Beneath the central ice formation lies a hidden passage to the Abyssal Trench, where sacrifices were once offered to appease what dwells below
Several ships contain cargo holds with perfectly preserved Nordic artifacts and treasures, untouched since the sudden freeze

objectives.description: Recover the Frostkey Totem needed to unlock the burial grounds entrance.

metadata.description: The Frozen Harbor stands as a grotesque monument to nature's wrath, where fishing vessels lie entombed in crystalline ice, their masts reaching skyward like skeletal fingers. Frigid winds howl through the abandoned dockhouses, carrying whispers of the damned as demonic frost patterns creep across every surface. Beneath the translucent ice floor, dark shapes occasionally drift bysome resembling drowned sailors, others defying mortal recognition entirely.
metadata.lore: Once a thriving northern port connecting Hiberian tribes with distant traders, the harbor froze suddenly during the Night of Crimson Aurora three generations ago, trapping hundreds in mid-escape. Elders speak of how the ice formed not from the surface down as nature dictates, but rose from the depths, suggesting whatever lies beneath has been corrupting the waters long before it claimed the land.
secrets: A partially preserved logbook in the harbormaster's office records unusual deep-sea catches in the weeks before the freezecreatures with anatomies that matched no known species.
Hidden beneath the altar of the dockside shrine is a map marking ritual sites along the coastline, with the harbor at its center, forming a demonic sigil visible only when viewed from above.

The ice itself contains microscopic demonic runes that slowly infect those who drink melted water from this area, explaining why rescue expeditions often returned with members exhibiting violent, paranoid behavior.

objectives.description: Gather ritual components from the abandoned fishing village to perform the opening ceremony.

metadata.description: The abandoned fishing village of Frosthaven lies half-buried under drifts of blackened snow, with rotting longboats frozen in perpetual launch toward a sea that gleams like obsidian glass. Twisted ice formations have engulfed the wooden structures, creating grotesque architectural abominations where homes once stood, while the northern lights overhead pulse with sickly purple and crimson veins that seem to beat in rhythm with something ancient stirring below.
metadata.lore: Frosthaven was once home to Hiberia's most prosperous whaling community until the Winter of Weeping, when villagers began carving strange runes into their flesh and disappearing beneath the ice. Local legend claims they discovered something ancient while digging burial chambers for their honored dead - something that whispered promises of warmth and eternal life to those willing to make blood offerings to the depths.
secrets: A hidden shrine beneath the village elder's home contains a frost-covered tome detailing rituals to bind and control ice demons
Several villagers were not corrupted but imprisoned in magical ice by their neighbors as sacrifices for the coming thaw
A network of tunnels beneath the village connects to a much larger demonic structure that predates human settlement in Hiberia
The village blacksmith created specialized weapons designed to combat the ice corruption before disappearing

transitions.name: Gate to Hrimthursar the Frost Shaman's Lair

objectives.description: Defeat the corrupted shaman who guards the entrance to the burial site.

metadata.description: Frigid saltwater crashes against jagged ice formations surrounding a profaned ritual site where the boundary between worlds has thinned. Ancient runes carved into frozen altars pulse with an unholy blue light, while the aurora above twists and writhes like a living entity, casting eerie shadows across the blood-stained snow. The distant echoes of chanting can be heard beneath the howling arctic winds, growing stronger as the tide recedes to reveal the entrance to the submerged chambers below.
metadata.lore: The Ice Ritual Grounds once served as a sacred site where Hiberian shamans communed with ancestral spirits during the winter solstice. When demonic corruption began seeping through dimensional faults beneath the ice shelf, the site became a nexus for cultists who believed the twisted northern lights were messages from entities beyond the mortal realm.
secrets: The ritual altars can be temporarily activated with the blood of sea creatures, revealing hidden passages that only appear during specific phases of the aurora.
Ancient Hiberian texts scattered throughout the grounds contain fragments of a banishment ritual that weakens the demonic entities when spoken in the correct sequence.
Beneath the main ritual circle lies a frozen Hiberian shaman, perfectly preserved for centuries, clutching an artifact that can control the tides to access the deepest chambers.
The demonic corruption is actually originating from a crashed celestial object buried deep within the ice, mistaken by the ancients as a gift from their gods.

transitions.name: Portal to Act 2: The Ancestral Crypts

dialogue.intro: The ice speaks to me now... it whispers of your doom! You cannot stop what grows beneath!
dialogue.defeat: The chill... it leaves my bones... beware what sleeps in the ancient halls...

metadata.description: A vast circular chamber carved from glacial ice, where the walls shimmer with an unnatural blue glow and massive icicles hang threateningly from the ceiling. The floor is a frozen pool of seawater, cracked and uneven, with ancient runic circles etched deep into the ice that pulse with cold energy when approached. At the chamber's center stands a crude altar made from whale bones and driftwood, surrounded by the frozen remains of failed challengers whose final expressions of terror are perfectly preserved in the ice.
metadata.lore: Hrimthursar was once a revered shaman who communed with the spirits of sea and storm, until he discovered ancient demonic texts buried in a shipwreck and became obsessed with extending his life through forbidden rituals. The coastal tribes speak of how the northern lights dimmed for three days when he completed his transformation, and how the sea itself retreated from the shore in disgust.
secrets: Hidden beneath the altar is a crack in the ice revealing a chamber below where Hrimthursar keeps his original human heart preserved in a jar of whale oil
The frozen victims around the room can be shattered to reveal enchanted trinkets and amulets they carried to protect themselves
Ancient runes carved into the whale bones can be activated in the correct sequence to temporarily weaken Hrimthursar's frost armor

objectives.description: Navigate through the hall of fallen warriors, whose bodies now rise to defend their corrupted resting place.

metadata.description: The Hall of Warriors stands as a vast chamber of stone and ice, where the honored dead of Hiberia's greatest champions rest in frozen tombs arranged in concentric circles around a central altar. Eerie blue light filters through translucent ice walls, casting long shadows that seem to move of their own accord, while ancient runes carved into support pillars pulse with a sickly crimson glow. The bitter cold here preserves the bodies of the fallen warriors perfectly, their faces locked in expressions of stoic determination, though frost now forms unnatural patterns across their skin that resemble demonic sigils.
metadata.lore: Once a sacred place where only the most revered warriors of Hiberian clans earned eternal rest, the Hall was sealed a millennium ago after the Battle of Frozen Tears. Legend claims the hall contains not only the physical remains but also the bound spirits of these warriors, sworn to defend Hiberia even in deatha final line of defense now being twisted by the corruption to serve the very evil they once fought against.
secrets: A hidden chamber behind the northernmost tomb contains the legendary Frostmourn axe, still clutched in the hands of Thane Jormund the Unyielding, whose spirit will test any who seek to claim it
The seemingly random pattern of runes on the floor actually forms a ritual circle that, when activated with the blood of a pure-hearted warrior, can cleanse the corruption from this chamber

Among the dead lies an impostora demon who infiltrated Hiberian society centuries ago and engineered his own burial here to corrupt the hall from within. His tomb, marked with a slightly different rune pattern, contains a phylactery sustaining the corruption

objectives.description: Collect the ancient rune tablets to decipher the prophecy of the demonic invasion.

metadata.description: Frost-rimed standing stones encircle a sunken chamber where ancient runes pulse with an unholy blue glow, their light reflecting off crystallized pools of frozen blood. The walls, carved with scenes of ancient nordic funerals, seem to writhe and distort as if the dead depicted are struggling to escape their eternal slumber, while the constant whisper of unintelligible voices echoes from nowhere and everywhere at once.
metadata.lore: The Chamber of Runes once served as the sacred heart of nordic burial rites, where runemasters would bind the souls of fallen warriors to prevent them from wandering. When demonic corruption seeped through the permafrost, the protective runes inverted their purpose, now drawing power from the bound souls to fuel a ritual that weakens the barrier between worlds.
secrets: A runemaster's journal hidden behind a loose stone reveals that one of the tribal elders deliberately sabotaged the protective runes decades ago after making a pact with something 'beneath the ice'
The central altar contains a hidden compartment accessible only when all the perimeter runes are deactivated, containing the Frostmourn Amulet
The frozen pools of blood will occasionally reveal glimpses of the demon realm when disturbed, showing visions of the invasion force gathering

transitions.name: Descent to Throne of the Jarl

objectives.description: Reach the ancient feasting hall where the corrupted chieftains gather to perform vile rituals.

metadata.description: Icicles hang like frozen daggers from the rafters of this massive mead hall, now entombed in layers of ancient ice that crack and groan with each step. Frost-covered skeletons of fallen warriors remain seated at long tables, their frozen mead horns still clutched in skeletal fingers, while runes carved into the support pillars pulse with an eerie blue glow that seems to respond to the whispers echoing through the hall.
metadata.lore: Once the feasting place of Jarl Hrothgar the Unyielding, this hall was deliberately frozen and sealed as a tomb for him and his most loyal warriors after they succumbed to a mysterious plague. Legends claim they chose living entombment rather than dying without weapons in hand, drinking poison mead together in a final feast while sorcerers froze the hall around them.
secrets: The ice in the center of the hall contains a perfectly preserved demon trapped mid-emergence from a portal, suggesting the 'plague' was actually demonic corruption
A hidden chamber beneath the high table contains the Jarl's winter runeblade, which can only be drawn by someone with giant's blood
The mead horns still contain liquid that grants temporary resistance to cold but causes disturbing visions of an army gathering beneath the ice

transitions.name: Gate to Jarl Isgrimm the Frostbound's Lair

objectives.description: Defeat the corrupted Jarl who has made a pact with the demons below.

metadata.description: The Throne of the Jarl stands as a monument to forgotten northern kings, where ice-rimed pillars stretch toward vaulted ceilings adorned with faded battle murals. Frost covers ancient weapons and armor displayed along the walls, while an otherworldly blue glow pulses beneath translucent ice floors, revealing glimpses of twisted shadows moving in the depths below. The air itself seems to crystallize with each breath, carrying whispers of ancient battle cries and the distant, rhythmic pounding of war drums.
metadata.lore: Once the sacred coronation site for the High Jarls of Hiberia, this hallowed chamber was sealed after the last true king sacrificed himself to bind an ancient frost demon beneath the throne. The demonic corruption now seeping upward suggests the binding ritual is failing after seven centuries of containment.
secrets: The true throne is hidden beneath the visible decoy - accessible only when the correct saga is recited before the ice wall behind the monument
Three frozen warriors in the antechamber can be temporarily revived to reveal the location of the Jarl's legendary frost-forged axe, Rimeheart
Ancient runes carved into the floor form a warding circle that, when activated with blood offering, provides temporary protection against the demonic cold
A hidden passage beneath the broken statue leads to the Jarl's personal armory, containing weapons specifically crafted to combat the demon he imprisoned

transitions.name: Portal to Act 3: The Frozen Abyss

dialogue.intro: My people sought warmth in the endless winter... The demons promised fire eternal! Now you will freeze with the rest!
dialogue.defeat: The pact... was a lie... Below in the depths... they prepare... their true champion...

metadata.description: A vast circular chamber carved from ancient ice and stone, with ornate nordic runes glowing faintly blue along the walls. Massive bear skulls and broken weapons lie frozen in the translucent floor, visible beneath a thin layer of frost that crunches underfoot. At the center stands a colossal throne of ice and bone, where the hulking silhouette of Jarl Isgrimm sits motionless, his breath visible as wispy tendrils of unnatural black frost.
metadata.lore: Once a revered chieftain who led his people through the Endless Winter, Jarl Isgrimm made a pact with demonic forces to preserve his tribe, only to be betrayed and transformed into the first of the Frostbound. The corrupted northern lights that now dance above these burial grounds are a manifestation of his fractured soul, calling forth his ancestors to serve the very evil he once fought against.
secrets: Behind the throne lies a cracked ceremonial drinking horn that, when filled with melted ice from the chamber, reveals visions of Isgrimm's final living moments and hints at the true source of the demonic corruption

The bear skulls embedded in the ice will animate and attack if the battle extends too long, but can be permanently disabled by tracing the correct rune sequence visible only when the northern lights shine through the chamber's ice skylights
A hidden alcove contains Isgrimm's original human heart, preserved in enchanted ice - destroying it will weaken him significantly but release a wave of corrupted spirits

objectives.description: Navigate through the labyrinthine ice caverns where reality begins to warp under demonic influence.

metadata.description: The Crystal Caverns form a mesmerizing labyrinth of translucent ice walls and jutting crystalline formations that refract ghostly blue light throughout the frozen chambers. Frost-rimmed stalagmites rise like the teeth of ancient beasts, while the distant sound of cracking ice echoes ominously through corridors adorned with the frozen remains of previous explorers. With each breath visible in the frigid air, an unnatural whisper seems to emanate from the very ice itself, carrying promises of power and eternal cold.
metadata.lore: Once a sacred meditation site for Hiberian shamans who communed with ancestral spirits through the ice's reflective properties, the Crystal Caverns were corrupted when demonic essence seeped through fissures during the Longest Night three centuries ago. The shamans' spiritual connection was twisted into a conduit for demonic possession, transforming them into the frozen guardians who still patrol these halls, their souls trapped in ice-preserved bodies that serve the ancient evil below.
secrets: Hidden within certain ice formations are perfectly preserved shamanic runes that, when activated with blood, temporarily reveal the spectral imprints of past events in the caverns.

A forgotten shrine to Ymir, the Frost Giant, contains a ceremonial dagger that can be used to harvest special crystals throughout the dungeon, which together form a key to the sealed Hibernation Chamber.
The seemingly random pattern of frozen corpses actually forms a constellation map that, when deciphered, reveals the location of a powerful artifact hidden beneath a false floor of ice.
Certain sections of the cavern walls are thinner than they appear and can be shattered to reveal hidden passages and chambers containing ancient Hiberian treasures.

objectives.description: Recover pieces of the shattered Frostbane Blade from the corrupted ice lake.

metadata.description: The Frozen Lake's surface has fractured into a labyrinth of jagged ice formations, with fissures revealing the black waters churning unnaturally below. Ethereal blue light pulses through translucent walls, casting long shadows that seem to move independently of their sources. The air itself feels hostile, burning the lungs with each breath while whispers echo from everywhere and nowhere at once.
metadata.lore: Once a sacred site where Hiberian shamans communed with ancestral spirits through the reflective ice, the Frozen Lake became forbidden after the Calamity of the Long Night when an entire council of elders was found frozen in poses of terror. Local legends claim the lake was formed from the tears of the frost goddess Nivera when she discovered her lover's betrayal, and that her grief still poisons the waters.
secrets: Bodies preserved in the ice reveal evidence of a forgotten civilization that worshipped entities from beyond the stars, their ritual implements matching symbols now appearing in the aurora

A network of narrow tunnels beneath the ice leads to a chamber containing the frozen form of Thormun the Exile, last of the true Hiberian kings, clutching a rune-etched horn that can command the winter winds
The lake's true depth is impossible to measure, as it connects to an inverted tower descending into the underworld, visible only when viewed through shards of ceremonial black ice
Ancient ward-stones at cardinal points around the lake have been subtly defaced, breaking a containment seal that had imprisoned a fragment of a demon lord for millennia

objectives.description: Destroy the demonic eggs that incubate in the frozen depths, guarded by their monstrous caretaker.

metadata.description: The Demonic Hatchery stretches before you as a perversion of natural ice formations, where crystalline stalactites pulse with an unholy crimson heartbeat and exhale plumes of sulfurous steam that freeze instantly into blood-tinted frost. Grotesque egg sacs hang from the ceiling, their translucent membranes revealing the twisted silhouettes of developing abominations, while the ground beneath your feet occasionally shifts as something massive moves through the network of tunnels below. The walls themselves seem alive, with veins of demonic corruption spreading like cracks through ancient glacial ice, pulsating in rhythm with distant, muffled shrieks.
metadata.lore: Once a sacred chamber where Hiberian shamans communed with ancestral spirits through the ice, this cavern was corrupted when the demon lord Azmodan's lieutenant, Kazeroth the Frostplague, discovered that the unique resonance of these nordic burial grounds could accelerate demonic gestation. The ancient protective runes carved by the Hiberian elders now serve as arcane conduits, their power inverted to nourish the unholy brood rather than ward against it.
secrets: Hidden within the ice walls is the frozen form of Jormund, last of the Hiberian shamans, who sacrificed himself in a failed ritual to contain the corruption. His staff, still clutched in his frozen hands, contains the last pure shard of the Aurora Crystal.

A network of narrow tunnels accessible only by destroying specific egg clusters leads to a chamber containing the Frost Forge, an ancient dwarven artifact capable of crafting weapons imbued with primordial cold that can counteract the demonic heat.

The rhythmic pulsing throughout the hatchery follows a specific pattern. Players who decipher and disrupt this rhythm by destroying key corruption nodes can temporarily weaken all demonic entities in the area.

Beneath the central platform lies a frozen lake where the reflection shows not the current hatchery, but its original form as a sacred siterevealing the locations of hidden runes that can be activated to purify sections of the dungeon.

transitions.name: Gate to Niflora the Frostbrood Mother's Lair

objectives.description: Reach the edge of the great rift where the barrier between realms grows thin.

metadata.description: The Abyssal Rift opens like a frozen wound in the earth, where glacial walls shimmer with an unnatural blue luminescence that casts long, distorted shadows across jagged ice formations. Frigid air burns the lungs and crystallizes each breath, while distant, otherworldly whispers echo through the winding passages, seeming to emanate from the ice itself. The ground occasionally trembles as though something massive stirs in the depths below, causing stalactites of razor-sharp ice to break free and crash down without warning.
metadata.lore: Once a sacred burial chamber for Hiberian high shamans, the Abyssal Rift was sealed after the Great Cataclysm when demonic energies first breached the mortal realm through these hallowed grounds. The ancient Hiberian runes etched into the ice wallsonce protective wardsnow glow with corrupted power, their magic twisted to serve as conduits for the demonic invasion rather than barriers against it.
secrets: A forgotten shrine hidden behind a wall of clear ice contains the frozen form of Ymir, the last High Shaman who sacrificed himself to temporarily seal the initial demonic incursion
Demonic runes carved beneath the ice floor reveal a ritual that can temporarily reverse the flow of corruption, but requires blood sacrifice
Ancient Hiberian weapons embedded in the ice walls can be recovered and retain enchantments specifically designed to combat the demonic entities from the Rift
A network of narrow, easily missed ice tunnels leads to a chamber containing the preserved remains of a demon scout party from an earlier, failed invasion attempt

transitions.name: Portal to Act 4: The Primordial Ice

dialogue.intro: My children grow strong in this frozen womb! Your warmth will feed their hunger, your soul will fuel their birth!
dialogue.defeat: My brood... will avenge me... The Herald rises... from the deepest ice...

metadata.description: Crystalline ice formations hang like jagged teeth from the ceiling of this massive, dome-shaped chamber, their surfaces reflecting eerie blue light that emanates from cracks in the frozen floor. At the center lies a nest of frost-rimmed bones and shattered armor, surrounded by a ring of perfectly preserved corpses locked in ice, their faces contorted in eternal terror as they reach outward in a futile attempt to escape.
metadata.lore: Niflora was once a revered winter spirit who guarded the passage between the living and ancestral realms, until demonic corruption twisted her protective nature into possessive malice. The bodies entombed in ice are not her victims, but her 'children' - warriors she deemed worthy to join her eternal brood, their souls trapped between life and death to serve as vessels for the spreading corruption.
secrets: A partially thawed corpse clutches a runic tablet revealing that Niflora can only be truly defeated if the three ceremonial braziers around the chamber are lit with 'flames of remembrance'
Hidden beneath a thin sheet of ice on the eastern wall is an ancient shrine where offerings to Niflora were once made - placing a personal item here may temporarily calm her frenzy
The frozen tears that fall from the ceiling contain fragments of Niflora's uncorrupted essence - collecting and consuming them grants temporary immunity to her frost breath

objectives.description: Battle through the heavily guarded entrance to the demonic sanctum hidden beneath the primordial ice.

metadata.description: A massive doorway hewn from blackened ice and twisted bone marks the entrance to the sanctum, where frigid air swirls with embers that burn without heat. Frozen nordic runes along the archway appear to bleed with a viscous crimson fluid that defies freezing, while the faint echoes of ancient chants seem to pulse from deep within the structure.
metadata.lore: Once a sacred burial chamber for Hiberia's most honored warriors, this entrance was transformed when the demon lord Kha'zir'ath began corrupting the site three centuries ago. The nordic shamans who attempted to seal the sanctum were themselves transformed into its first guardians, their souls bound to prevent others from interfering with the demonic metamorphosis occurring within.
secrets: The blood-runes can be read by those who place a fallen warrior's weapon against them, revealing the true name of the demon lord
A hidden mechanism in the central floor tile can temporarily reverse the corruption, revealing the original burial chamber and a cache of uncorrupted nordic artifacts
The ethereal whispers are not random - they form a cipher that, when decoded, reveals the weakness of the guardians deeper within

objectives.description: Find and destroy the unholy altars where nordic souls are harvested to power the demonic portal.

metadata.description: Blood-slicked obsidian altars rise from a floor of cracked ice, where crimson rivulets flow in unnatural patterns that seem to pulse with malevolent awareness. Massive chains of frozen iron hang from the vaulted ceiling, occasionally swaying without any breeze, while the walls are adorned with ancient Nordic runes that have been desecrated and recarved into demonic sigils. The bitter cold of this chamber doesn't numb the senses but rather heightens them, forcing visitors to experience every moment of dread with terrible clarity.
metadata.lore: Once the sacred heart of Hiberian burial rites, this chamber was where tribal elders would prepare the honored dead for their journey to the afterlife. When the demonic corruption first seeped through, it was drawn to this nexus of spiritual power, twisting the ancestral magic and transforming the chamber into a conduit that feeds souls directly to entities beyond mortal comprehension.
secrets: The chains hanging from the ceiling are actually the preserved spinal columns of the first seven tribal shamans who attempted to cleanse this place
Hidden beneath the central altar is an ancient Nordic weapon that can be reconsecrated if bathed in the blood of its wielder
The ice floor conceals dozens of preserved bodies arranged in a massive summoning circle, visible only when the northern lights shine directly through the chamber's ceiling aperture
One of the demonic sigils contains a coded message from a previous adventurer who discovered the corruption's true source

transitions.name: Descent to The Eternal Winter Throne

objectives.description: Recover the Frostbane Blade's hilt and reforge the legendary weapon to combat the final demon lord.

metadata.description: The Frozen Heart pulses with a nauseating rhythm, its ice walls veined with pulsating crimson energy that throbs like a grotesque heartbeat. Frigid air burns the lungs while whispers of torment echo through crystalline chambers, where demonic runes carved into permafrost glow with unholy light. Frozen corpses of previous adventurers stand as silent sentinels, their faces locked in eternal screams as the ice preserves their final moments of horror.
metadata.lore: Once the sacred burial chamber of Hiberia's most revered frost shamans, this sanctum was corrupted when a desperate king made pacts with entities from beyond the veil to save his dying realm. The demons twisted the shamans' preservation magic, creating an unholy nexus where the barrier between realms grows thinner with each passing century.
secrets: A still-living frost shaman is entombed in the central chamber, conscious but immobilized for centuries, holding critical knowledge about sealing the demonic portal
Ancient nordic runes hidden beneath layers of ice can be activated to temporarily suppress demonic powers throughout the dungeon
The true source of corruption is not the obvious demonic altar, but rather a seemingly innocent ceremonial drinking horn that serves as the anchor point between realms
Frozen tears collected from the petrified adventurers can be used to forge a weapon of extraordinary power against the demonic entities

transitions.name: Gate to Rimefang, Herald of the Frozen Apocalypse's Lair

objectives.description: Confront and defeat Rimefang, the Demon Lord of Eternal Winter, before his invasion of Hiberia can begin.

metadata.description: A vast cathedral of ice and bone where the air itself seems to crystallize with each exhaled breath, revealing whispers of the damned. Demonic runes pulse with unholy light beneath the translucent floor, casting eerie shadows across massive frozen thrones arranged in a circle around a central altar. The walls weep with black ichor that refuses to freeze, slowly dripping down to form pools of corruption that smoke with unnatural cold.
metadata.lore: Once the sacred council chamber of Hiberia's first kings, this hallowed ground was corrupted when Queen Helsvith made a pact with the demon lord Glacius to save her people from a devastating famine. The demon twisted her sacrifice, preserving the royal bloodline in eternal torment while using their frozen bodies as conduits to channel his influence into the mortal realm.
secrets: The central altar contains a shard of the original Frostmourne, a weapon that can permanently kill demons but slowly transforms its wielder into ice
Behind the largest throne is a hidden passage leading to Queen Helsvith's private chambers, where her journal reveals the true ritual needed to banish Glacius
The black ichor pools, when viewed from above, form a map revealing the locations of other demonic sanctums across Hiberia
Every hour, when the ethereal bells toll, the frozen monarchs momentarily awaken and can be communicated with, though their minds are fractured and corrupted

areas.name: Rimefang, Herald of the Frozen Apocalypse's Lair

boss.name: Rimefang, Herald of the Frozen Apocalypse

dialogue.intro: At last, a worthy soul approaches! The eternal winter I bring is not death, mortal - it is transformation! All of Hiberia shall become my frozen kingdom!
dialogue.defeat: Impossible... I am... endless... like winter itself... My master will... avenge... this defeat... The true lord of frost... will rise...

metadata.description: Massive pillars of jagged ice rise from the polished obsidian floor, reflecting eerie blue light that pulses like a dying heartbeat. The air is supernaturally cold, causing each breath to crystallize instantly, while ancient nordic runes carved into the walls glow with a sickly white luminescence. At the center of this vast chamber stands a throne made from the frozen remains of fallen warriors, their faces eternally locked in expressions of agony.
metadata.lore: Rimefang was once a revered frost giant shaman who protected the northern tribes, until he discovered forbidden knowledge in the depths of the Frozen Void. His communion with entities beyond the veil transformed him into the first of the Frozen Heralds, tasked with preparing Hiberia for a demonic winter that would last a thousand years.
secrets: The nordic runes along the walls can be deciphered to reveal a ritual that temporarily grants immunity to Rimefang's frost aura
Four small alcoves hidden behind ice formations contain sacrificial altars - destroying all four will weaken Rimefang's connection to his demonic patrons
The frozen warriors comprising Rimefang's throne are not dead but suspended in time - freeing them will cause them to aid the player in the final battle
